sense.name: a physical framework of crossing strips, often wooden
sense.examples: Roses climbed the lattices at the edge of Mary's garden. We looked up through the lattice of branches at the blue sky. Betty crossed strops of dough to make a lattice on top of the cherry pie. I handed money through the lattice to the ticket agent.

sense.name: a 3-dimensional uniform and repeating arrangement of particles
sense.examples: The metal's atoms are arranged in a lattice. The molecules of the crystal form a symmetric lattice.

sense.name: a partially-ordered mathematical set
sense.commentary: LATTICE[+relation][+mathematical][+set][+partially_ordered] Note: a lattice has, for each pair of elements, a lowest upper bound and a greatest lower bound
sense.examples: This book covers lattices, semi-lattices and group theory. The least upper bound for a pair of elements in a lattice is called a join.
